name: Large-scale human intracranial electrophysiology and eye-tracking recordings from naturalistic image and movie stimuli
citation: Nentwich, Maximilian (2025) Large-scale human intracranial electrophysiology and eye-tracking recordings from naturalistic image and movie stimuli (Version draft) [Data set]. DANDI Archive. https://dandiarchive.org/dandiset/001613/draft
description: This dataset includes 50 recording sessions of intracranial EEG and simultaneous eyetracking from 46 individual patients. Implants consist of a total of 10,806 contacts predominantly from depth electrodes, and 988 from ECoG contacts (grids and strips). Patients watched up to 53.6 minutes of movies (48 recordings), completed resting state (25 recordings) and viewed static images (31 recordings). Data is provided in NWB and BIDS format and includes local field potentials, electrode locations. gaze and pupil size, precise timing of each frame in the movie and annotations of words and phonemes in one of the movies.
